commit_message:
Transform scheduler.select_destinations notification

Transform the scheduler.select_destinations.start and
scheduler.select_destinations.end notifications to the
versioned notification framework.

Change-Id: I019e88fabd1d386c0d6395a7b1969315873485fd
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-stein
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/508506/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.notifications.objects import scheduler as scheduler_notificationdef notify_about_scheduler_action(context, spec, action, phase=None, source=fields.NotificationSource.SCHEDULER): """Send versioned notification about the action made by the scheduler :param context: the RequestContext object :param spec: the RequestSpec object :param spec: the name of the action :param action: the name of the action :param phase: the phase of the action :param source: the source of the notification """ payload = scheduler_notification.SchedulerPayload(spec=spec) notification = scheduler_notification.SchedulerNotification( context=context, priority=fields.NotificationPriority.INFO, publisher=notification_base.NotificationPublisher( host='dummy', source=source), event_type=notification_base.EventType( object='scheduler', action=action, phase=phase), payload=payload) notification.emit(context) @rpc.if_notifications_enabled

commit_message:
Update to the ceilometer publisher list

Template level changes to update endpoint list
in ceilometer to support data dispatch to
qdr running locally.

commit_message:
[queens-only] Remove primary role constraint to deploy NodeTLSData

NodeTLSData is needed everywhere HAproxy is deployed.
Therefore, if multiple roles have HAproxy, we need to remove the primary
role constraint on this resource otherwise it's only deployed on the
node tagged controller & primary.
With this patch, we'll deploy NodeTLSData on roles tagged "controller".

Change-Id: I670d292f6051a373298e4ff0cc59f763aa3eee63
Closes-Bug: 1822327

deleted_lines: {%- if 'primary' in role.tags and 'controller' in role.tags %} {%- if 'primary' in role.tags and 'controller' in role.tags %} {%- if 'primary' in role.tags and 'controller' in role.tags %}

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I18fb748132a28e61de11b70aca115656c230ec6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/32/649732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/stein} {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff

commit_message:
Sync policy.json files with service projects

Policies are generated using oslopolicy-sample-generator
according to Horizon 'Policy file maintenance' guide [1].

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance

Change-Id: If31c072ab14e1746969b7f94e6837722cefa28ea
Closes-Bug: #1821289
(cherry picked from commit 36170ed3cb5464773c9768c5fd1ef8c7487b5aee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/84/649984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | policy.json files for Cinder, Keystone Neutron and Nova are generated according to `Policy file maintenance <https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance/>`__. Keystone changes to `policy rules <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/stein.html#prelude>__`, are not compatible with the Horizon so we keystone_policy.json is not updated. Please, be sure that new Keystone policies are compatible with your deployment before syncing them.

subject: Fix RabbitMQ locale for CentOS 7 (t-h-t part)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-03 18:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-notify-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-rpc-pacemaker-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ceb005b07f84deb491afa19238833edc06c06531', 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ locale for CentOS 7 (t-h-t part)

It seems that CentOS 7 does not have C.UTF-8 locale. Since we need
UTF-8-based locale, use en_US.UTF-8 instead.

Change-Id: Id510565edd33e6f4d409afc7a4afb938ab2f9fd0
Partial-Bug: #1823062
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ locale for CentOS 7 (t-h-t part)

It seems that CentOS 7 does not have C.UTF-8 locale. Since we need
UTF-8-based locale, use en_US.UTF-8 instead.

Change-Id: Id510565edd33e6f4d409afc7a4afb938ab2f9fd0
Partial-Bug: #1823062
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/97/649697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - 'LANG=en_US.UTF-8' - 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8'

commit_message:
Use Stein release for all OpenStack projects

Versions were generated via the following command:

tools/version-check.py --openstack-release stein --include-independent

Some other versions had to be changed manually, including those not
managed via the OpenStack release process.

Revert this on master once kolla stable/stein branch has been created.

Change-Id: I7cf31fd3ef7d236b9356b379a664968071dbf297

Add support to ping IPv6 metadata IP

Change-Id: Ifc5d690da7e01b3b710eae80d0f6f9f6822b48fa
Closes-Bug: #1757110
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/07/554507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: METADATA_IP=$(os-apply-config --key $URL --key-default '' --type raw 2>/dev/null | sed -e 's|http.*://\[\?\([^]]*\)]\?:.*|\1|') _ping=ping if [[ "$METADATA_IP" =~ ":" ]] ; then _ping=ping6 fi until $_ping -c 1 $METADATA_IP &> /dev/null; do

commit_message:
Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff
(cherry picked from commit 141190bc661d1b88a2e9cac07490d0a1869c6895)

added_lines: timeout: 1800 timeout: 5400

commit_message:
Have lib/tempest to create shared network

In order to make sure not possible to introduce a change in tempest
which breaks the shared network compatibility.

Depends-On: I6e3e53c4ac26b4fef09fefb9c590dfa91f577565

Change-Id: Ib2e7096175c991acf35de04e840ac188752d3c17

commit_message:
Revert "Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq"

This reverts commit bc9b922ddcdb6625b0e4c8b67851b3843d1d8775.

This seems to have broken the upgrade jobs. It might just
be the HA configurations which we've dropped from most jobs.
Related-Bug: #1823062
Change-Id: I300dc69ebd93728d792746c6bce798e0391de17c

commit_message:
Fix spare amphora check and creation

This patch fixes an issue when the SparesPool table is empty that blocks
spare amphorae creation. It creates a new spares pool entry if the table
is empty.

Story 2005352
Task 30306

Change-Id: I0ce2778277640ee9e509c709bf8621b8b025d6d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/66/649766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Seed the spares_pool table Revision ID: 46d914b2a5e5 Revises: 6ffc710674ef Create Date: 2019-04-03 14:03:25.596157 """ import datetime from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '46d914b2a5e5' down_revision = '6ffc710674ef' def upgrade(): # Create temporary table for table data seeding insert_table = sa.table( u'spares_pool', sa.column(u'updated_at', sa.DateTime), ) # Note: The date/time doesn't matter, we just need to seed the table. op.bulk_insert( insert_table, [ {'updated_at': datetime.datetime.now()} ] )

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 21:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-basic/run.yaml', 'playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-with-os-ken-master-scenario-ipv4/run.yaml', 'playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-functional/run.yaml', 'playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv4/run.yaml', 'playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-api/run.yaml', 'playbooks/neutron-dynamic-routing-dsvm-tempest-scenario-ipv6/run.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing/commit/73fa76d9f90e0634c3abc6e6eddd4e689a25ce1f', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia852b0748dcd099f88ee4521117fe0806018788d
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia852b0748dcd099f88ee4521117fe0806018788d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/56/646656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: https://git.openstack.org \ DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin neutron-dynamic-routing https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing" DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin neutron-tempest-plugin https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin"

commit_message:
Use gabbi-tempest job from gabbi-tempest plugin

That plugin[1] makes it possible to create small zuul jobs that define a
GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH, pointing to where the gabbits are. Resulting in a
very low-config way to do gabbi integration tests.

Therefore, we change the existing placement-tempest-gabbi job into
placement-gabbi-tempest (a name more aligned with the preferred naming
scheme for tempest-related jobs) and remove the no longer required
tempest-gabbi-link playbook.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/gabbi-tempest

Change-Id: Ica4789e5ed3112ec47a1f144242751dcee7eb853
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/08/607508/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Changes that run through devstack-tempest are likely to have an impact on # the devstack part of the job, so we keep devstack in the main play to # avoid zuul retrying on legitimate failures. - hosts: all roles: - orchestrate-devstack # We run tests only on one node, regardless how many nodes are in the system - hosts: tempest tasks: - name: setup tempest run dir include_role: name: setup-tempest-run-dir - name: setup tempest data dir include_role: name: setup-tempest-data-dir - name: acl devstack files include_role: name: acl-devstack-files - name: Link gabbits dir into tempest dir file: state: link src: "{{ devstack_base_dir|default('/opt/stack') }}/placement/gate/gabbits" dest: "{{ devstack_base_dir|default('/opt/stack') }}/tempest/gabbits" - name: run tempest include_role: name: run-tempest

This is a an attempt at running gabbits for an integration test.
There are two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize

The Depends-On is necessary to get a working devstack, which
itself Depends-On getting a working wsgi app.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8

'}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2018-10-02 08:02:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/a878de259c2d8ddda4af97baf851838f6b3bbd49', 'message': "Initial integration test using gabbits

This provides a gabbi-tempest based integration (with nova)
test for placement. A zuul playbook is provided which runs
tempest with the gabbi-tempest plugin. Gabbits come from
gate/gabbits. Adding more tests (once this has merged) is
a simply matter of adding more gabbi files in that directory.

This patch provides two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize

A custom playbook is provided so we can link gate/gabbits into
the tempest directory, where they can be found by the plugin.
This reuses the roles from the usual devstack-tempest playbook.

This is not yet a perfect solution but it does move us in the
right direction. Things to consider for future iterations:

* Not installing gabbi-tempst from github.

* More granular control over which services are runnning so
  that build time before we get to the actual tests is short.

* Updating tempest's built-in tox setup and zuul configuration
  so that the GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH variable can be used, removing
  the need for the gate/gabbits symlink. GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH
  allows one or more directories to be searched for gabbits.
  The end game is being able to make a zuul job which sets just
  that, and then the magic happens.

For future reference, one thing that was rather confusing for me
in this process is that zuul v3 and devstack aren't entirely playing
well together. zuul does it's own cloning of relevant repos, and
then later devstack does too, to somewhere else. As a result of
that confusion, I had originally been trying to make the symlink
in the wrong place.

The Depends-On is necessary to get a working devstack.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8
"}, {'number': 31, 'created': '2018-10-03 09:27:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/ec29c3c591afbac3af087d9651777b82a069ab9f', 'message': "Initial integration test using gabbits

tempest with the gabbi-tempest plugin. Gabbits come from
gate/gabbits. Adding more tests (once this has merged) is
a simply matter of adding more gabbi files in that directory.

This patch provides two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize

A custom playbook is provided so we can link gate/gabbits into
the tempest directory, where they can be found by the plugin.
This reuses the roles from the usual devstack-tempest playbook.

This is not yet a perfect solution but it does move us in the
right direction. Things to consider for future iterations:

* Not installing gabbi-tempst from github.

* More granular control over which services are runnning so
  that build time before we get to the actual tests is short.

* Updating tempest's built-in tox setup and zuul configuration
  so that the GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH variable can be used, removing
  the need for the gate/gabbits symlink. GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH
  allows one or more directories to be searched for gabbits.
  The end game is being able to make a zuul job which sets just
  that, and then the magic happens.

For future reference, one thing that was rather confusing for me
in this process is that zuul v3 and devstack aren't entirely playing
well together. zuul does it's own cloning of relevant repos, and
then later devstack does too, to somewhere else. As a result of
that confusion, I had originally been trying to make the symlink
in the wrong place.

The Depends-On is necessary to get a working devstack.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8

commit_message:
Initial integration test using gabbits

This provides a gabbi-tempest based integration (with nova)
test for placement. A zuul playbook is provided which runs
tempest with the gabbi-tempest plugin. Gabbits come from
gate/gabbits. Adding more tests (once this has merged) is
a simply matter of adding more gabbi files in that directory.

This patch provides two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize. Because resize
  can take fairly inconsistent amounts of time to accomplish
  we wait for up to 5 minutes for VERIFY_RESIZE.

A custom playbook is provided so we can link gate/gabbits into
the tempest directory, where they can be found by the plugin.
This reuses the roles from the usual devstack-tempest playbook.

This is not yet a perfect solution but it does move us in the
right direction. A followup patch to this includes many of
these improvements. This is kept as two separate patches as
this one helps make the variety of pieces involved more clear.

* Not installing gabbi-tempest from github.

* More granular control over which services are runnning so
  that build time before we get to the actual tests is short.

* Updating tempest's built-in tox setup and zuul configuration
  so that the GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH variable can be used, removing
  the need for the gate/gabbits symlink. GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH
  allows one or more directories to be searched for gabbits.
  The end game is being able to make a zuul job which sets just
  that, and then the magic happens.

For future reference, one thing that was rather confusing for me
in this process is that zuul v3 and devstack aren't entirely playing
well together. zuul does it's own cloning of relevant repos, and
then later devstack does too, to somewhere else. As a result of
that confusion, I had originally been trying to make the symlink
in the wrong place.

Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8

commit_message:
stop using common_db_mixin

This patch removes all use of common_db_mixin. All methods of that
class are available in some form from neutron-lib and we are removing
the mixing from neutron soon.

Change-Id: I80d17a491d4468a94f4ae184f1b453f41cdf92a2

commit_message:
Release freezer for 7.1.0 and 2.2.0

At the last vPTG, The freezer team decided to release
freezer using the cycle-with-intermediary method.

- freezer-api: 7.1.0
- freezer: 7.1.0
- freezer-web-ui: 7.1.0

Change-Id: Ib9709ef6899b87a0c28fbf9f0c4e6af083f5de45

commit_message:
The script name displayed is separated by spaces when the exec job is abnormal;
such as,when i execute 'freezer-agent --action exec --command /home/backup.sh',
reported error:while executing script / h o m e / b a c k u p . s h return code was 1 instead of 0

Change-Id: Iea2f04af8672b3abd4f684b7cb5120a9e1b77cf9

commit_message:
Add NetApp E-Series Driver to Removal List

While auditing drivers that were removed during the Stein
release I noticed that the NetApp E-Series removal was
not notated in the support matrix.  This patch corrects
that mistake.

Change-Id: Ie4fe7a26b59b4142eb7a379e8cdea228cef24b27

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia4da4f94ecada34246a4db95174fa42595f9ff86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/85/646485/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: https://git.openstack.org $ZUUL_PROJECT

commit_message:
change the nova cache to dogpile.cache.memcached

Currently there are issues with using the memcache_pool backend as
the memcache driver for nova under python3[0][1] which doesnt seem
like they have a quick fix or something that is backportable to
rocky

This moves the default cache from oslo_cache.memcache_pool to
dogpile.cache.memcached so we can move forward with python3
enabled images.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1812672
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.cache/+bug/1812935

Change-Id: I65a4770c374357a8e1c80d904bcd4af36217448f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/21/644821/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: backend: dogpile.cache.memcached

commit_message:
libvirt: smbfs: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

The 'writethrough' cache mode is terribly slow.  Use the saner
alternative, "writeback" cache mode.

See further details in the documentation of change Ibe236988af2
("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode when 'none' is not viable).

Related-Bug: #1818847

Change-Id: I2d84c8576c01202fa4ec73a57aa739e2a2f66d06
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/643377/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: conf.driver_cache = 'writeback'

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-22 15:00:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher/commit/ab38bbfeec3e35a07a34e77f20c2b9d4f54fbe43', 'message': 'Fix lower-constraint deps handling

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraint deps handling

When the lower-constraints tox target was added, it was assumed the
install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

This also raises the oslo.context minimum as
Ic96c1f1e1a80099d9dafa95a014fc47f05b88e42 added a dependency on a newer
versions kwarg.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647726/

Change-Id: I4cc2c3ac158a607b22295c50f83896969a4007ee
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/09/645609/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}deps = -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Sync policy.json files with service projects

Policies are generated using oslopolicy-sample-generator
according to Horizon 'Policy file maintenance' guide [1].

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance

Change-Id: If31c072ab14e1746969b7f94e6837722cefa28ea
Closes-Bug: #1821289

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I620380741243cf16307ef106d67d44a820b0fbb4

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I1c5f31eba103847f8eaa9cdb4b37659b52db12f9

commit_message:
Asserting 'summary get' returns nothing in functional tests

Since no data is available in devstack in our functional test environment,
we make the assertion that 'summary get' returns nothing. This is prone to
update if more complete test scenarios are implemented.

Change-Id: Ic80e39f0d2a75882762ebd6a0dba46033c9fd7f4
(cherry picked from commit a7e687f7405c8c7fb36762c7725fffa7b19895f7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cloudkittyclient refs/changes/64/649964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp = self.runner('summary get') self.assertEqual(len(resp), 0)

commit_message:
Fix Generate test-list file task

Currently in Generate test-list file task, shell script used to
generate test-list gets cancatnates with the whitelist-file
options leading to saying whitelist file not found.

Removing - from jinja conditionals fixes the issue

Change-Id: I05f08cfbaca4d030d20079f22080340d6e1c7239
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix redis expected parameter type

This patch changes expected types of Redis' parameters from string to
integer because in Redis driver during parsing info all values
are converted to integer or float.

Change-Id: Ibb0cba582889c7e3dca3b8bd8b50e3103e954aee

commit_message:
Allow running a no-op validation

The idea here is to be able to run a validation
called np-op in order to test the framework in the CI.

Also we should create a group validation called no-op running
only this validation.

Change-Id: Ied6eaa4009d624737d2dfac8a61f3a273537ce13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/12/649312/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- metadata: name: NO-OP validation description: > A simple validation doing nothing in order to test that the validations framework works. groups: - no-op

commit_message:
Use fedora28-stein dlrn path for periodics

The periodics release file for fedora stein was merged at [1] but dlrn
url does not include stein, this review add stein suffix.

Change-Id: I7c4491d31089db00aded0435c5ec3af2fdf4cda4
Closes-Bug: #1823066

commit_message:
libvirt: vzstorage: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

The 'writethrough' cache mode is terribly slow.  Use the saner
alternative, "writeback" cache mode.

See further details in the documentation of change Ibe236988af2
("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode when 'none' is not viable).

Related-Bug: #1818847

Change-Id: I5aae681bc8e8feb7703a89f91b942360dd69c35d
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/643376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual('writeback', conf.driver_cache)

commit_message:
Set the lower version of sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme to 0.10.0

* Sphinx 2.0.0 was released on Mar 28 and sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme
  became incompatible with it. The version 0.10.0 was released
  to fix that.
* See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649264/

Depends-On: I0378297e099412191a4adc41e53b0eb23f6c43ae
Change-Id: Icb0163f553af690192bfab0e192a32d793db28a9

commit_message:
overriding attributes should be the next logical presedence

- using normal to override the attribute will still give the
  chance to override it.

Change-Id: I24210a953871f37b380eceb297597a6f6629d7af

commit_message:
fix rabbitmq config

- since we are using distro_packages for rabbitmq the default rabbitmq
  config name is broken overriding this attribute fixes this
- bugfix version bumped

Change-Id: Ia732d5ac4c64eab2126bbc385998585c96ff23d9
(cherry picked from commit 3187b91c8f9228662b24ed9de0a6780d004b251b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-messaging refs/changes/39/649539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: normal['rabbitmq']['config'] = '/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config'

subject: Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-26 12:34:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher/commit/e404b7f000d89caae83e6b10f409412cf65ef5eb', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-27 01:15:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher/commit/f5efff13c983d8ad838bf7d4b2cfe876bdf487ad', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

commit_message:
Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

3. RUN END RESULT_TIMED_OUT:
[untrusted : git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/
zuul-jobs/playbooks/tox/run.yaml@master]

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

For the third error, the reason is that the version of the oslo_messaging
is too low.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers for Stein release

As a part of the Stein release, we need to ensure
that charmhelpers is up to date.

commit_message:
Remove the tempest_test_whitelist from playbook

Have this fact set here makes hard to override it on featureset.
Removing it, and moving this to featureset_override on job definition

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/901?kanban-status=1447275

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/648110
Change-Id: Ia3066bb5d9dab86226576b8a9f5fc6ca06e52f1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/11/648111/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (6)

Replace mox with mock
in test methods in the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNS class
and the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNSPortbinding class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.

Remove the following methods of the TestNeutronv2Base class.

* _allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_show_port
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_list_networks
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_create_port

The original TestNeutronv2Base class is removed and
the _TestNeutronv2Common class is renamed to 'TestNeutronv2Base'.

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I554105d413d980015e5872b24fa8d7022a794a37
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-train

nets_in_requested_net_order.append(network) api.get_instance_nw_info(mox.IgnoreArg(), self.instance, networks=nets_in_requested_net_order, port_ids=ports_in_requested_net_order, self.moxed_client.create_port( MyComparator(port_req_body_create)).AndReturn(res_port) def _allocate_for_instance(self, net_idx=1, **kwargs): api = self._stub_allocate_for_instance(net_idx, **kwargs) commit_message:
Asserting 'summary get' returns nothing in functional tests

Since no data is available in devstack in our functional test environment,
we make the assertion that 'summary get' returns nothing. This is prone to
update if more complete test scenarios are implemented.

Change-Id: Ic80e39f0d2a75882762ebd6a0dba46033c9fd7f4

commit_message:
[RFC] Introduce the Padawan program

Short description of what we are trying to achieve with
the Padawan program, along with example entry.

This is a strawman proposal meant to discuss if this is
the direction we want to be going for improving the
help-most-needed list, or if something else is more
desirable.

Change-Id: Ie551287788254fa0d09b47d4c88ba2f681e12eab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/56/636956/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================= Padawan program ================= Joining and becoming a key member of an OpenStack project team can be a daunting task. Luckily, we have a number of experienced team members interested in spending significant time to guide and grow new team members ! The Padawan program is a list of areas in need of help or new members, where an experienced contributor is offering a one-on-one, in-depth mentoring to facilitate the work of the volunteer who signs up to help. Open Padawan offers =================== *No padawan offer in the program yet* Example offer ------------- * Mentor name, IRC, email, and TZ: * Project team: * Area in need of help: Current Padawans ================ *No padawan in the program yet*

subject: Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-04 07:57:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/c0fd3d9a6e68c4b4aa483d7ea8433bf9e412e844', 'message': "Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function

If users specify parameters in 'flavor' or 'image' properties
of a VDU, HOT template can not be processed properly because
there is a missmatch between TOSCA and HOT template.

This patch will change 'get_input' to 'get_param' to fix that
issue.

commit_message:
Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function

If users specify parameters in 'flavor' or 'image' properties
of a VDU, HOT template can not be processed properly because
there is a missmatch between TOSCA and HOT template.

This patch will change 'get_input' to 'get_param' to fix that
issue.

Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha<dharmendra.kushwaha@india.nec.com> 
Change-Id: I353e9d9d70dc6249a62dcdd1281b7b60d28d7d30
Closes-Bug: #1813135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/10/649910/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # change from 'get_input' to 'get_param' to meet HOT template if isinstance(val, dict): if 'get_input' in val: val['get_param'] = val.pop('get_input')

subject: Improve Mnesia IO performances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-28 15:17:09.000000000', 'files': ['templates/rabbitmq.config.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq-server-mnesia-io-d9067e226c7cb19c.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/615b60df8e039e5998383f93a6ee88e5695a6321', 'message': 'Improve Mnesia IO performances

With this configuration, the database Mnesia reduces the activity to the
disk. It is useful when a huge of queues/exchanges/bindings are created
and destroyed.
With the default value (100), RabbitMQ could log {Mnesia is overloaded}.
Moved to 300. The range should be between 100 and 1000.
Read [1] for more info.

[1] http://erlang.org/doc/man/mnesia.html#dump_log_write_threshold

Change-Id: I6dcfc9db02bcd8c8f0a1ebf58d9c3ceb84cae10a
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Mnesia IO performances

With this configuration, the database Mnesia reduces the activity to the
disk. It is useful when a huge of queues/exchanges/bindings are created
and destroyed.
With the default value (100), RabbitMQ could log {Mnesia is overloaded}.
Moved to 300. The range should be between 100 and 1000.
Read [1] for more info.

[1] http://erlang.org/doc/man/mnesia.html#dump_log_write_threshold

Change-Id: I6dcfc9db02bcd8c8f0a1ebf58d9c3ceb84cae10a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/37/648437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Mnesia configuration # The Mnesia dump_log_write_threshold option controls # how often the dumping occurs # Increase this value can increase the performances, # reducing the IO. # Increase it in case of: # Mnesia is overloaded: {dump_log,write_threshold}. # The default value is 100 mnesia_dump_log_write_threshold: 300

Change-Id: I442511d3232da90484886dbf169b53b8acf4681c

commit_message:
Bug-fix: attach_type or control path type should be majuscule.

The sysinfo based fpga driver report attach_type or control path type as "pci"
which will cause an error of creating related object in conductor.

Change-Id: I442511d3232da90484886dbf169b53b8acf4681c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/97/649897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: driver_cpid.cpid_type = "PCI" driver_ah.attach_type = "PCI"

removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

commit_message:
s3token: Add an underscore to the end of reseller_prefix if not present

This matches the behavior of tempauth/keystoneauth with regard to reseller_prefix.

Change-Id: I10f8bc354d0f45dd692915de86857679e9ca3446
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/43/617043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.utils import config_true_value, split_path, get_logger, \ append_underscore self._reseller_prefix = append_underscore( conf.get('reseller_prefix', 'AUTH'))
deleted_lines: from swift.common.utils import config_true_value, split_path, get_logger self._reseller_prefix = conf.get('reseller_prefix', 'AUTH_')

commit_message:
Normalize operation messages into capital case

Operation messages use sentence case in html files
(e.g. 'Create port') while capital case in js files
(e.g. 'Create Port'). Normalize them to use capital case in order
not to generate different translation items for same message.

Change-Id: Ic991d42a4a152f237d7df315d104ac802b7104cc

commit_message:
WIP: Created check_and_complete delayed call if it is latest task in branch

A Check_and_complete delayed calls really decrease performance
mistral-engine and database under load.

Change-Id: If74bdde4f2bd2c7953f5385c2dc370c4b803809b
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/33/555233/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print("!!!!!!!!{}!!".format(num_incomplete_tasks))def _get_completion_check_key(wf_ex_id): return 'wfh_on_c_a_c-%s' % wf_ex_iddef _schedule_check_and_complete(wf_ex_id): key = _get_completion_check_key(wf_ex_id) 0, wf_ex_id=wf_ex_id
deleted_lines: _schedule_check_and_complete(wf.wf_ex) if not states.is_completed(wf_ex.state): delay = ( 2 + int(num_incomplete_tasks * 0.1) if num_incomplete_tasks else 4 ) # Rescheduling this check may not happen if erros are # raised in the business logic. If the error is DB related # and not considered fatal (e.g. disconnect, deadlock), the # retry annotation around the method will ensure that the # whole method is retried in a new transaction. On fatal # errors, the check should not be rescheduled as it could # result in undesired consequences. # In case there are some errors that should not be # considered fatal, those should be handled explicitly. _schedule_check_and_complete(wf_ex, delay) _schedule_check_and_complete(wf_ex) if wf_ex.task_execution_id: _schedule_check_and_complete(wf_ex.task_execution.workflow_execution) def _get_completion_check_key(wf_ex): return 'wfh_on_c_a_c-%s' % wf_ex.iddef _schedule_check_and_complete(wf_ex, delay=0): key = _get_completion_check_key(wf_ex) delay, wf_ex_id=wf_ex.id

commit_message:
Workflow Error Analysis Client.[WIP]

The updates propose in this review will compliment the work which will
be done on the mistral engine side for the follow blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-error-analysis

Once completed, it will allow the operator to execute a report command
from mistral and receive the formatted output proposed in the spec.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443217/

Change-Id: I54b0eb1d004bcc0ae510480ad609d4bc2a50f6a8

commit_message:
Try to enable dnsmasq process several times

Sometimes, during restart of dnsmasq process it may happend that
after process is killed, start attempt is made too fast, before
old process really unbind from IP address on which it was listening.
That causes an issue with starting dnsmasq process again.

In patch [1] disable() method was changed that it can wait
until process is really not active (no pid for it) but that didn't
solve the problem with starting a new dnsmasq process completely and
sometimes it still happens, at least in functional tests.

So now, enable() method is changed so that it will try to enable
dnsmasq process for 1 minute, until it will really be spawned properly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634390/

Change-Id: I18d73b787fa3ab8803e12d5e5eb2bb7109205aba
Closes-Bug: #1811126
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/643732/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: common_utils.wait_until_true(self._enable) except common_utils.WaitTimeout: LOG.error("Failed to start DHCP process for network %s", self.network.id) def _enable(self): try: if self.active: self.restart() elif self._enable_dhcp(): fileutils.ensure_tree(self.network_conf_dir, mode=0o755) interface_name = self.device_manager.setup(self.network) self.interface_name = interface_name self.spawn_process() return True except exceptions.ProcessExecutionError as error: LOG.debug("Spawning dhcp process for network %s failed; " "Error: %s;", self.network.id, error) return False self._get_process_manager().disable() if block: common_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: not self.active)
deleted_lines: if self.active: self.restart() elif self._enable_dhcp(): fileutils.ensure_tree(self.network_conf_dir, mode=0o755) interface_name = self.device_manager.setup(self.network) self.interface_name = interface_name self.spawn_process() pm = self._get_process_manager() pm.disable() if block: common_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: not pm.active)

commit_message:
Setting the lower version of sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme to 0.10.0

* Sphinx 2.0.0 was released on Mar 28 and sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme
  became incompatible with it. The version 0.10.0 was released
  to fix that.
* See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649264/

Depends-On: I0378297e099412191a4adc41e53b0eb23f6c43ae
Change-Id: Icb0163f553af690192bfab0e192a32d793db28a9

commit_message:
Fix the rating.get_quotation method

This updates the rating.get_quotation method of the client. Tests on this
method have been added.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/648062/
Change-Id: Ie2de0162311c2d162c1573042187ac4e628bd966
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cloudkittyclient refs/changes/63/648063/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2019 Objectif Libre # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import decimal from cloudkittyclient import exc from cloudkittyclient.tests.unit.v1 import base class TestRating(base.BaseAPIEndpointTestCase): def test_quote_request(self): res_data = [{'usage': { 'instance': [{ 'vol': {'unit': 'undef', 'qty': '1'}, 'rating': {'price': decimal.Decimal(1)}, 'desc': { 'disk_total_display': 1, 'image_id': 'c43a3e7d-c4e6-45d6-8c8d-e2832a45bc0a', 'ram': 64, 'ephemeral': 0, 'vcpus': 1, 'source_type': 'image', 'disk_total': 1, 'flavor_id': '42', 'flavor': 'm1.nano', 'disk': 1, 'source_val': 'c43a3e7d-c4e6-45d6-8c8d-e2832a45bc0a'} }] }}] self.rating.get_quotation(res_data=res_data) self.api_client.post.assert_called_once_with( '/v1/rating/quote/', json={'resources': res_data}) def test_get_quotation_no_res_data(self): self.assertRaises(exc.ArgumentRequired, self.rating.get_quotation)

subject: Add functional test for the JsonFilter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-26 16:57:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_json_filter.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/88c20a168ee89293751bd22ad621d1d8eb305693', 'message': 'Add functional test for the JsonFilter

Before this we had no functional testing of the JsonFilter.
Given it is a pretty complicated filter we should have
functional testing for it, so this adds a simple test which
is using a commonly reported pattern which is filtering
hosts based on hypervisor_hostname for trying to build
a baremetal server on a specific ironic node.

commit_message:
Add functional test for the JsonFilter

Before this we had no functional testing of the JsonFilter.
Given it is a pretty complicated filter we should have
functional testing for it, so this adds a simple test which
is using a commonly reported pattern which is filtering
hosts based on hypervisor_hostname for trying to build
a baremetal server on a specific ironic node.

Change-Id: Id63d32501c97d2d27e5c61d8d46fff3e3c791505
Related-Bug: #1821764
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/11/647811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from nova import conf from nova.scheduler import weights from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers CONF = conf.CONF class HostNameWeigher(weights.BaseHostWeigher): # JsonFilterTestCase creates host1 and host2. Prefer host1 to make the # tests deterministic. _weights = {'host1': 100, 'host2': 50} def _weigh_object(self, host_state, weight_properties): # Any undefined host gets no weight. return self._weights.get(host_state.host, 0) class JsonFilterTestCase(integrated_helpers.ProviderUsageBaseTestCase): """Functional tests for the JsonFilter scheduler filter.""" microversion = '2.1' compute_driver = 'fake.SmallFakeDriver' def setUp(self): # Need to enable the JsonFilter before starting the scheduler service # in the parent class. enabled_filters = CONF.filter_scheduler.enabled_filters if 'JsonFilter' not in enabled_filters: enabled_filters.append('JsonFilter') self.flags(enabled_filters=enabled_filters, group='filter_scheduler') # Use our custom weigher defined above to make sure that we have # a predictable scheduling sort order during server create. self.flags(weight_classes=[__name__ + '.HostNameWeigher'], group='filter_scheduler') super(JsonFilterTestCase, self).setUp() # Now create two compute services which will have unique host and # node names. self._start_compute('host1') self._start_compute('host2') def test_filter_on_hypervisor_hostname(self): """Tests a commonly used scenario for people trying to build a baremetal server on a specific ironic node. Note that although an ironic deployment would normally have a 1:M host:node topology the test is setup with a 1:1 host:node but we can still test using that by filtering on hypervisor_hostname. Also note that an admin could force a server to build on a specific host by passing availability_zone=<zone>::<nodename> but that means no filters get run which might be undesirable. """ # Create a server passing the hypervisor_hostname query scheduler hint # for host2 to make sure the filter works. If not, because of the # custom HostNameWeigher, host1 would be chosen. query = jsonutils.dumps(['=', '$hypervisor_hostname', 'host2']) server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( self.api, 'test_filter_on_hypervisor_hostname') request = {'server': server, 'os:scheduler_hints': {'query': query}} server = self.api.post_server(request) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.admin_api, server, 'ACTIVE') # Since we request host2 the server should be there despite host1 being # weighed higher. self.assertEqual( 'host2', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname'])

commit_message:
Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function

If users specify parameters in 'flavor' or 'image' properties
of a VDU, HOT template can not be processed properly because
there is a missmatch between TOSCA and HOT template.

This patch will change 'get_input' to 'get_param' to fix that
issue.

Change-Id: I353e9d9d70dc6249a62dcdd1281b7b60d28d7d30
Closes-Bug: #1813135
Depends-On: Ib95ed31c70073cb732d41defe5bdc8027eadfeec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/69/634469/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # change from 'get_input' to 'get_param' to meet HOT template if isinstance(val, dict): if 'get_input' in val: val['get_param'] = val['get_input'] del val['get_input']

commit_message:
Libvirt: support per node overrides

This commit adds support for per-node overrides to the libvirt chart.

For example, to enable a relaxed ACS check on one host, but not another,
one may have the following in the override values file:

conf:
  overrides:
    libvirt_libvirt:
      hosts:
      - name: host1.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 1
      - name: host2.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 0

Story: 2005283
Task: 30140

Change-Id: Ia3431db6b78692ec0140cce1bab9bae5937318a4
Signed-off-by: Steven Webster <steven.webster@windriver.com>

fixed by including I56947e0d2bb207b59b0b3928efc96546d6410f43.

owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/71/649171/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mode: 0755

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1df6ef7d5645cf370c959d8b2577f20ad7917ef9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/43/645443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/17/645817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: qos_extension_enabled()def qos_extension_enabled(): network_driver = utils.get_network_driver() if not network_driver.qos_enabled(): raise exceptions.ValidationException(detail=_( "VIP QoS policy is not allowed in this deployment."))

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: Idc547d0b0e1157a4f6e7f8b0da8bf3ba68f8d16f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/59/649859/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: If64b0ca044bab88c6f3297c1bce3b44c731f817a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/30/649830/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-01 19:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/baremetal/tasks/pre-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/404dd96343e3fb25590a29b504ef1c952650a54a', 'message': 'Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)

subject: [Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-01 21:31:32.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/rabbitmq.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1a4f0603c6f5a8c4eaff0f67a3616b0cf9fe7d89', 'message': '[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/649194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add promotion-testing-hash-stein.yml for Fedora-28

The Fedora-28 promotion jobs require a promotion-testing-hash-stein
release file for the stein pipeline.

Change-Id: Ieeb4bf2db9250ffec1e5b126f5838bbe311746e6
Closes-Bug: #1823066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/06/649706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: devmode: true overcloud_as_undercloud: true use_specific_hash: true docker_registry_host: trunk.registry.rdoproject.org docker_registry_namespace: tripleostein delorean_hash_label: &promotion-testing-tag "{{ dlrn_hash|default(dlrn_hash_tag) }}" docker_image_tag: *promotion-testing-tag images: - name: overcloud-full url: "{{ overcloud_image_url }}" type: tar - name: ipa_images url: "{{ ipa_image_url }}" type: tar inject_images: - "ironic-python-agent.initramfs" - "ironic-python-agent.kernel" - "overcloud-full.qcow2" - "overcloud-full.initrd" - "overcloud-full.vmlinuz" release: stein dlrn_hash_tag: tripleo-ci-testing # TODO: These images should point to Fedora-specific locations overcloud_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/stein/rdo_trunk/current-tripleo/overcloud-full.tar ipa_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/stein/rdo_trunk/current-tripleo/ironic-python-agent.tar repo_cmd_before: | sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/*.rpmsave; sudo dnf clean all; sudo dnf config-manager --set-disabled "*" if [ -e /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh ]; then source /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh else export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR={{ lookup('env','NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR')|default('http://mirror.centos.org/centos', true) }} # Otherwise, fallback to official mirrors provided by Fedora. export NODEPOOL_FEDORA_MIRROR={{ lookup('env','NODEPOOL_FEDORA_MIRROR')|default('https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux/', true) }} # TODO: Is there a Fedora equivalent or NODEPOOL_BUILDLOGS_CENTOS_PROXY? export NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY=https://trunk.rdoproject.org fi rdo_dlrn=`curl --silent ${NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY}/fedora28/{{ dlrn_hash_path|default(dlrn_hash_tag, true) }}/delorean.repo -S 2>>~/dlrn_repo_curl_errors.log | grep baseurl | cut -d= -f2` if [[ -z "$rdo_dlrn" ]]; then echo "Failed to parse dlrn hash" exit 1 fi fedora_stable="https://trunk.rdoproject.org/fedora28/stable-base/latest/" export RDO_DLRN_REPO=${rdo_dlrn/https:\/\/trunk.rdoproject.org/$NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY} export FEDORA_STABLE=${fedora_stable/https:\/\/trunk.rdoproject.org/$NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY} repos: - type: generic reponame: delorean filename: delorean.repo priority: 20 baseurl: $RDO_DLRN_REPO - type: generic reponame: delorean-stein-deps filename: delorean-stein-deps.repo baseurl: $FEDORA_STABLE repo_cmd_after: | # TODO(aschultz): remove this after we solve having a default cron sudo dnf install -y cronie; sudo dnf install -y yum-plugin-priorities; sudo dnf repolist; sudo dnf clean metadata {% if repo_setup_run_update|default(true)|bool %} sudo dnf update -y sudo dnf install ntpdate -y {% endif %} undercloud_rpm_dependencies: python3-tripleoclient ansible_python_interpreter: /usr/bin/python3

commit_message:
Style corrections for privsep usage.

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

I've corrected the existing style mismatches to make things consistent.
Note that the next patch in this series covers this case with a
hacking check.

Change-Id: Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-04 03:25:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/containers/copy-object-modal.html'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6833cd9abcd5b9133e5a7a0cee7e8b4b5640e1d1', 'message': 'Error location does not match Fields on copy form under container panel

the Destination Object is input, the Destination object
will be wrong, but no error message will be reported;
if the Destination container exists,
the Destination object will input an existing object,

Closes-Bug: #1823113

commit_message:
Error location does not match Fields on copy form under container panel

On the copy form under container panel,
if the Destination Container does not exist and
the Destination Object is input, the Destination object
will be wrong, but no error message will be reported;
if the Destination container exists,
the Destination object will input an existing object,
which will cause the Destination container error

This bug is due to check-copy-destination
checking both containers and objects.

Change-Id: I8bc2e26835a0e690f94d8c0762807db599248d1b
Closes-Bug: #1823113

deleted_lines: ng-class="{'has-error': copyForm.dest_container.$invalid && copyForm.dest_container.$dirty}"> ng-class="{'has-error': copyForm.dest_name.$invalid && copyForm.dest_name.$dirty}">

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I2ffcaf9054ae032385c6338edcccc3030771a853

commit_message:
allow transferring ownership of instance

Adds functionality to placement and nova to allow transferring ownership
of an instance (a consumer in placement-land) from one project to
another (and one user to another). The proposal is for an admin-only
action, done via the REST API.

Change-Id: I08c7370dee330453136931f216d2b54bf4dadc23
blueprint: transfer-ownership
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/98/599598/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Transfer ownership of an instance ================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/transfer-ownership In the lifecycle of a virtual or baremetal machine -- particularly long-lived "pet" machines -- it's sometimes necessary to move the ownership of the instance from one organization to another. Sometimes organization's priorities or missions change, requiring a transfer of that organization's resources to another organization. Problem description =================== In large organizations with tens or hundreds of thousands of virtual or baremetal machine resources, it's common that an organization's mission or priorities change. When missions change, often the resources that were owned by an organization need to be transferred to another organization. Currently, when this happens, Nova provides no ability through its API to perform this transfer of ownership. Instead, the operator is required to either manually update a variety of database records or rely on external information to track ownership of a particular instance. Both approaches tend to be error-prone. In the former approach, fat-fingering a typo in a SQL statement manually executed against a database can be disastrous. In the latter approach, instead of being able to use the canonical owner of a Nova instance (the OpenStack project ID), additional metadata or tags need to be specified against an instance and then this additional metadata then needs integration with external inventory management systems. Use Cases --------- As an OpenStack user of some baremetal machines, the organization for which I work has changed direction and applications running on those baremetal machines are now under the management of a different group within my company. I wish to change the `project_id` of the instances currently under my organization to the new managing organization's `project_id` without powering down or reimaging the machines. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to add the ability to transfer ownership of an instance via a new microversion to the placement and Compute API. The placement REST API will get a new ``PUT /consumers/{consumer_id}`` endpoint, accepting a request payload containing the new project and user along with the consumer's generation. The ``PUT /servers/{server_id}`` Compute REST API endpoint will get a new microversion that adds support for two new attributes in request payload's ``server`` dict: ``owner_project`` and ``owner_user``. The value of the new ``owner_project`` attribute shall be the project ID of the project that the requestor wishes to transfer ownership of the server instance *to*. Likewise, the value of the ``owner_user`` attribute shall be the user ID of the user to transfer ownership *to*. A successful transfer of ownership will continue to result in a ``200 OK`` response. By default, an admin-only policy will be enforced on this new attribute, meaning only superuser/admins can transfer the ownership of an instance between projects. Attempting to change the owning project/user by a non-admin will result in a ``403 Forbidden`` response. The target project will have its quota checked to ensure it has enough quota to accept the new instance. The ``owner_user`` must be a member of ``owner_project``. Non-members will trigger a ``400 Bad Request`` response. The target instance's attached volumes must be transferred to the new target project separately using the Cinder API's `volume transfer API`_. Unfortunately, that API involves a multi-step, manual acceptance process and is not something that can be done during an instance's ownership transfer. Some external orchestration system might be able to coordinate the various manual processes involved, however, wrapping the ownership transfer of an instance and its volume(s) in a single operation. .. _volume transfer API: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#volume-transfer-3-55-or-later There does not seem to be a way to transfer the ownership of associated ports in Neutron's API. Doing this ownership transfer must be done as a manual exercise by the operator against the Neutron database. Alternatives ------------ We could continue to do nothing and provide no functionality for operators to move ownership of an instance from one project to another outside of manual Nova database updates and external scripts. Instead of using a REST API microversion, we could add instance ownership transfer as an operation to the operator-facing ``nova-manage`` CLI tool that mucks with the placement and nova cell DBs directly. We could enforce some kind of "lock" on the server instance before attempting to transfer the ownership of the instance. In other words, perform a lock instance, then transfer ownership, then unlock instance. This would prevent migrations or other operations, though it's unclear whether or not those operations would have an adverse impact on the ownership transfer process. We could add some manual "acceptance" step to the ownership transfer process, similar to how Cinder's API works. However, this is not automation-friendly and seems like it is forcing a public cloud provider's worldview. Plus, making the operation admin-only makes the acceptance step moot. We could add a brand new REST API endpoint instead of using the existing ``PUT /servers/{server_id}`` Compute REST API endpoint. This would allow us to use different semantics from the "update server document" semantics that the ``PUT /servers/{server_id}`` endpoint currently entails. For instance, we could make the call asynchronous with a callback to determine the results of the ownership transfer. Data model impact ----------------- There are no changes to the data model. We will continue to use the ``instances.project_id`` and ``instances.user_id`` fields to store the "owning project" and "owning user" of the instance. REST API impact --------------- Placement API changes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The placement service will get a brand new API endpoint for modifying a consumer's information. The new ``PUT /consumers/{consumer_id}`` endpoint will accept the following request payload:: { "project_id": "<external ID of project>", "user_id": "<external ID of user>", "generation": <current generation of consumer> } On success, a ``204 No Content`` shall be returned. When no such consumer with an ID of ``{consumer_id}`` is found, a ``404 Not Found`` will be returned. When the generation supplied does not match the known server-side generation of the consumer, a ``409 Conflict`` will be returned. Note that the placement API is currently admin-only, so any attempt by a non-admin user to any placement API endpoint will result in a ``403 Forbidden`` being returned. Compute API changes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The ``PUT /servers/{server_id}`` Compute API endpoint will get two new request payload attributes in the request's ``server`` object: * ``owner_project``: the ID of the project to transfer the instance ownership to. * ``owner_user``: the ID of the user to transfer the instance ownership to. On successful transfer, a ``200 OK`` will continue to be returned. If a non-admin fills in the value of ``owner_project`` or ``owner_user`` a ``403 Forbidden`` will be returned. If quota for the new project or user would be exceeded, a ``400 Bad Request`` will be returned. If ``owner_user`` is not a member of ``owner_project``, a ``400 Bad Request`` will be returned. Security impact --------------- Keeping this functionality an admin-only operation should solve most security-related concerns. Notifications impact -------------------- We should definitely send out a new notification event when transfer of ownership is done. This will allow external systems to react to the event. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jaypipes Other contributors: TBD Work Items ---------- * Add new ``PUT /consumers/{consumer_id}`` REST API endpoint to the placement service that atomically updates a consumer's project and user * Add a ``transfer_ownership()`` method to ``nova/compute/api.py`` * This step will need to call out to the new placement service REST API microversion to update the project and user ID of a consumer * Add a new microversion to the Compute REST API that adds the ``owner_project`` and ``owner_user`` attributes to the ``PUT /servers/{server_id}`` request payload * Tests, tests and moar tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Focus will be on functional tests involving a fully-stood-up placement and compute API service interaction. Documentation Impact ==================== Reference docs will be needed for both the Compute and placement APIs. Admin-facing docs should be written explaining the process of transferring ownership of an instance and the manual steps (e.g. the SQL calls needed for Neutron port ownership transfer) that may be involved. References ========== None

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I272535f2597f770f0964d8b1ed75277f5a1b27df

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError for tempest verifier

In case of missing admin credentials, rally is raising unexpected and
not userfriendly AttributeError. This patch is fixing this.

Change-Id: I5da96a7508f14626d0db9c7cbf817d66452af4ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/93/648693/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not self.credential: raise exceptions.ValidationError( "Failed to configure 'tempest' for '%s' environment since " "admin credentials for OpenStack platform is missed there." )
